revised_title: Vital Staining of Acinar Cells and its Implications on Theories of Vital Staining with Basic Dyes
tldr: The author investigates the vital staining of acinar cells in the pancreas and its impact on theories of vital staining with basic dyes. They discuss the staining mechanisms of different dyes and their effects on cell structures, providing evidence for and against the "vacuome" theory proposed by Parat. The study contributes to the understanding of cellular mechanisms and the role of the Golgi apparatus in cell structure and function.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Cell Biology
